<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [22d1663ab1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17355/commits/22d1663ab12434f2393f4fca6c881f9574054583)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coconeOfIsLeftKanExtension`
`+ colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension`
`+ coneOfIsRightKanExtension`
`+ constCompWhiskeringLeftIso`
`+ isColimitCoconeOfIsLeftKanExtension`
`+ isLimitConeOfIsRightKanExtension`
`+ lanCompColimIso`
`+ limitIsoOfIsRightKanExtension`
`+ limitIsoOfIsRightKanExtension_hom_π`
`+ limitIsoOfIsRightKanExtension_inv_π`
`+ ranCompLimIso`
`+ ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_hom`
`+ ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_inv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Input on how to maybe speed up compilation time welcome :shrug:
Also I *think* I've made the universes as general as possible, but a second pair of :eyes: wouldn't hurt

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11525896872/job/32089051639)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11525896872/job/32089051787)

These is a more general construction, given `F'` a left Kan extension of `F` along `L`, then any colimit cocone for `F` gives a colimit cocone for `F'`:
```lean
variable (F' : D ⥤ H) {L : C ⥤ D} {F : C ⥤ H} (α : F ⟶ L ⋙ F') [F'.IsLeftKanExtension α]

@[simps]
noncomputable def coconeOfIsLeftKanExtension (c : Cocone F) : Cocone F' where
  pt := c.pt
  ι := F'.descOfIsLeftKanExtension α _ c.ι

def isColimitCoconeOfIsLeftKanExtension {c : Cocone F} (hc : IsColimit c) :
    IsColimit (F'.coconeOfIsLeftKanExtension α c) where
  desc s := hc.desc (Cocone.mk _ (α ≫ whiskerLeft L s.ι))
  fac s := by
    have : F'.descOfIsLeftKanExtension α ((const D).obj c.pt) c.ι ≫ 
        (Functor.const _).map
          (hc.desc (Cocone.mk _ (α ≫ whiskerLeft L s.ι))) = s.ι :=
      F'.hom_ext_of_isLeftKanExtension α _ _ (by aesop_cat)
    exact congr_app this
  uniq s m hm := hc.hom_ext (fun j ↦ by
    have := hm (L.obj j)
    nth_rw 1 [← F'.descOfIsLeftKanExtension_fac_app α ((const D).obj c.pt)]
    dsimp at this ⊢
    rw [assoc, this, IsColimit.fac, NatTrans.comp_app, whiskerLeft_app])
```
Then, `lanCompColimIso` should be redefined as `NatIso.ofComponents` of the isomorphisms obtained by `coconePointUniqueUpToIso` using suitable colimit cocones.
Thanks! I thought about attempting that generality but I was kind of afraid of the naturality proof, but maybe I'm too pessimistic. Will try your approach.
Are you sure the naturality can be proven if we use `coconePointUniqueUpToIso`? I feel like we lack coherence if we don't construct the iso explicitely.
(see attempt in the commit below)
Ah, nvm, I think it is possible :grin:
Good! But note that the general construction (anything but `lanCompColimIso` and its dual) should go in the more basic file `KanExtension.Basic`.

I think there is a dual statement to this, namely

```lean
@[simps!]
def constCompWhiskeringRightIso (F : D ⥤ C) :
    const J ⋙ (whiskeringRight J D C).obj F ≅ F ⋙ const J :=
  NatIso.ofComponents fun X => NatIso.ofComponents fun Y => Iso.refl _
```
(though `constCompWhiskeringLeftIso` is also unused, so you could also decide not to include it in the PR).
Yes, I think I'll just add the dual, it's definitely a useful statement
The dual is right above, as `compConstIso`
Oops, sorry about that.

It would be more convenient to define here the isomorphism on colimits (and similarly for limits):
```suggestion

section

variable [HasColimit F] [HasColimit F']

noncomputable def colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension : colimit F' ≅ colimit F :=
  IsColimit.coconePointUniqueUpToIso (colimit.isColimit F')
    (F'.isColimitCoconeOfIsLeftKanExtension α (colimit.isColimit F))

@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_hom (i : C) :
    α.app i ≫ colimit.ι F' (L.obj i) ≫ (F'.colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension α).hom =
      colimit.ι F i := by
  simp [colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension]


@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_inv (i : C) :
    colimit.ι F i ≫ (F'.colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension α).inv =
      α.app i ≫ colimit.ι F' (L.obj i) := by
  rw [← cancel_mono (F'.colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension α).hom, assoc, assoc,
    Iso.inv_hom_id, ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_hom, comp_id]

end

```
Then, the construction of the natural isomorphism involving `lan` becomes easier (see other comment).

```suggestion
noncomputable def lanCompColimIso (L : C ⥤ D) [∀ (G : C ⥤ H), L.HasLeftKanExtension G]
    [HasColimitsOfShape C H] [HasColimitsOfShape D H] : L.lan ⋙ colim ≅ colim (C := H) :=
noncomputable def lanCompColimIso (L : C ⥤ D) [∀ (G : C ⥤ H), L.HasLeftKanExtension G]
    [HasColimitsOfShape C H] [HasColimitsOfShape D H] : L.lan ⋙ colim ≅ colim (C := H) :=
  Iso.symm (NatIso.ofComponents
    (fun G ↦ (colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension _ (L.lanUnit.app G)).symm)
    (fun {G G'} f ↦ colimit.hom_ext (fun i ↦ by
    dsimp
    rw [ι_colimMap_assoc, ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_inv,
      ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_inv_assoc, ι_colimMap, ← assoc, ← assoc]
    congr 1
    exact congr_app (L.lanUnit.naturality f) i)))
```
Indeed, the naturality condition can be checked more easily for the inverse isomorphism.

```suggestion
    (fun G ↦ limitIsoOfIsRightKanExtension _ (L.ranCounit.app G))
```

```suggestion
  rw [Iso.comp_inv_eq, assoc, ι_colimitIsoOfIsLeftKanExtension_hom]
```

We should insert "to the limit of" somewhere. Could you also make all the docstrings of the declarations slightly more self contained? Like, "if `F'` is a right/left Kan extension of a functor `F` along a functor `L`, then...".

```suggestion
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/KanExtension): Composing `lan` with `colim`
